Package it.unicam.cs.pa.jbudget105053.javafx

Interface JavaFXController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaFXAccountCreatorController, JavaFXAccountModifierController, JavaFXAccountRemoverController, JavaFXJBudgetController, JavaFXMovementCreatorController, JavaFXMovementRemoverController, JavaFXTagCreatorController, JavaFXTagModifierController, JavaFXTagRemoverController, JavaFXTransactionCreatorController, JavaFXTransactionRemoverController
    public interface JavaFXController
    This interface is implemented by all the classes of the GUI view of the app that have the responsibility to launch an Alert window or another JavaFX controller window in general.
    Author:
    Tommaso Catervi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default void close​(javafx.scene.control.Control control)
      Closes the window of a JavaFX controller by closing the stage.
      default boolean createConfirmationAlert​(java.lang.String message)
      Creates a new confirmation Alert window with a specific message and then shows it.
      default void createErrorAlert​(java.lang.String message)
      Creates a new error Alert window with a specific message and then shows it.
      default void startWindow​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String path, JavaFXController controller)
      Opens a new FXML window from a specific path and then sets its title with the given title parameter and its controller with the given one.

    • Method Detail

      • createErrorAlert

        default void createErrorAlert​(java.lang.String message)
        Creates a new error Alert window with a specific message and then shows it.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to show on the Alert window.

      • createConfirmationAlert

        default boolean createConfirmationAlert​(java.lang.String message)
        Creates a new confirmation Alert window with a specific message and then shows it.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to show on the Alert window.
        Returns:
        true if ButtonType.OK is selected, false otherwise.

      • startWindow

        default void startWindow​(java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String path,
                         JavaFXController controller)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a new FXML window from a specific path and then sets its title with the given title parameter and its controller with the given one.
        Parameters:
        title - the title to set as the window title.
        path - the path of the .fxml file to be read.
        controller - the JavaFXController that will manage the window.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error with the reading of the .fxml occurs.

      • close

        default void close​(javafx.scene.control.Control control)
        Closes the window of a JavaFX controller by closing the stage. The stage to close is obtained from a FXML control element of the controller, usually the abortButton.
        Parameters:
        control - the FXML control element whose stage needs to be closed.
